p: Current epidemiological data indicate that children and younger adults have been deeply infected with the 2009 pandemic influenza A [ 92]. Therefore, children should be the primary target group for vaccination. According to the American Academy of Pediatrics, the vaccine must be included in the repetitive immunization regimen for children aged 5 to 18 years [ 93]. The study showed that LAIV was 82% effective against pandemic influenza A in children 2–8 years of age and that its efficacy decreased by 11% in children 9–17 years of age [ 94].
